GeneralInformation.History: Founded by King William I of the Netherlands in 1817. The official language of the University was originally Latin; this changed to French in 1830 and to Dutch in 1930. Ghent University is today one of the most important academic institutions of Belgium and has an important international educational and scientific role. Acquired present status and title 1991.
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate or recognized foreign equivalent; Entrance examination for engineering and medicine programs

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1425, UCL is one of the oldest universities in the world. Erasmus, Jansenius, Vesalius, Mercator, Georges Lemaître worked or taught at the UCL. In 1970, separation into two distinct universities, the Flemish-speaking one remained on the original site in Leuven. The French-speaking University moved to Wallonia (Louvain-la-Neuve). The faculty of Medicine moved to Brussels. Merged with Université Saint-Louis - Bruxelles (IAU-019835) which became a campus of UCL.
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate and entrance examination, or foreign qualifications if recognized under agreement concluded with the Belgian Government
Other foreign qualifications subject to the approval of the faculty concerned

GeneralInformation.History: The Université libre de Bruxelles has 13 faculties, schools and specialized institutes combining academic input and research. It offers almost 40 undergraduate programmes and 235 graduate programmes. It also partners with 20 Doctoral schools, with almost 1,600 PhD in progress
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate or recognized foreign equivalent; Entrance examination; Entrance examination; Certificate of French language proficiency

GeneralInformation.History: Founded under King William I of the Netherlands in 1817. Designated as a State University following the independence of Belgium in 1835. Provision was made in 1959 for the transfer of the University to a new campus. The University enjoys limited autonomy and receives the major share of its income from the Communauté française de Belgique
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate or recognized foreign equivalent and entrance examination in French for non-native speakers
Entrance examination for engineers

GeneralInformation.History: Created from the merger of Faculté polytechnique de Mons (Faculty of Engineering, Mons, created 1837) and Université de Mons-Hainaut (University of Mons-Hainaut, created 1899) in 2009
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate or recognized equivalent; Entrance examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1959 as IPO (Institute for Postgraduate Education), became University Antwerp Management School in 2000 and acquired current title 2010.
Founded in 1834. Distinguished maritime personality in 1907. IMO (STCW) international quality rules and standards implemented in 2002
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Diploma secundar onderwijs) or recognized equivalent

GeneralInformation.History: Founded from the merger of Artesis University College and Plantijn University College in 2013. Part of the Antwerp University Association of University Colleges.
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Diploma secundar onderwijs) or recognized equivalent

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1949. Since 1992 the College has operated on two campuses in two host countries, in Bruges (Belgium) and in Natolin (Poland). They are administered by their respective governing bodies, respectively under Belgian and Polish legislation
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: August to June (August - December; January - June)

Divisions.College: EU International Relations and Diplomacy Studies

Address.college_name: Erasmus Brussels University of Applied Sciences and Arts

GeneralInformation.History: Founded as a merger of several university colleges in 1995. A university-level institution financed by the State and student tuition. Part of the University Association Brussels
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: September to June (September - January; February - June)
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Diploma secundar onderwijs) or recognized equivalent; Admissions examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded as ‘Limburgs Universitair Centrum’ (LUC) in 1971. Acquired present status in 2005
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Diploma secundar onderwijs) or recognized equivalent

GeneralInformation.History: Founded through the merger of 13 Hogescholen in 1995. Part of the Ghent University Association.

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1994. Earned NVAO Quality Status in 2017

GeneralInformation.History: Founded as a technical institute in 1879. Acquired present title in 1977. Merged and acquired present status in 1995. Part of the Ghent University Association of University Colleges. A university level provincial institution receiving financial support from the State.

AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Diploma secundar onderwijs) or recognized equivalent

Address.college_name: Karel de Grote University of Applied Sciences and Arts

GeneralInformation.History: Founded from the merger of 13 former Catholic Antwerp colleges in 1995. Part of the Antwerp University Association
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Diploma secundair onderwijs) or recognized equivalent; Entrance examination for Department of Arts

GeneralInformation.History: Founded by Bull of Pope Martin V on the initiative of Duke John of Brabant in 1425. Collegium Trilingue established by Erasmus in 1517. Suppressed under French occupation and closed during the reigns of Napoleon and William I of Holland. Re-established as Catholic University by Belgian episcopate in 1834. Reorganized with two divisions in 1969, the Katholieke Universiteit te Leuven and the Université catholique de Louvain which became separate legal entities in 1970. The titular head of the University is the Cardinal Archbishop of Malines. An institution independent of direct State control, receiving full state subvention
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Diploma secundar onderwijs) or recognized foreign equivalent

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1884 on the basis of a Roman Catholic neo-Gothic Art Philosophy. A private university-level institution. Acquired present status in 1991
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Diploma secundar onderwijs) or recognized equivalent; Entrance examination

campus Sint-Lucas, Ghent; campus Sint-Lukas, Brussels
campus Sint-Lucas, Ghent and campus Sint-Lukas, Brussels

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1925. Officially recognized in 1937. Acquired present status following the merger of Hogeschool‑Universiteit Brussel (HUB) and Katholieke Hogeschool Sint‑Lieven (KAHO) in 2014. Part of the KU Leuven Association
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Diploma secundar onderwijs) or recognized equivalent

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1906 as a training institute for doctors and nurses working in the Congo. Earned current status in 1931. Internationally recognized in the fields of science, medicine, and education.

AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Diploma secundar onderwijs) or recognized equivalent

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 2003 from the merger of three institutions; Universitaire Instelling Antwerpen (UIA), Universitaire Faculteiten St. Ignatius te Antwerpen (UFSIA), Universitaire Centrum Antwerpen (RUCA). A member of the Antwerp University and Colleges Association (AUHA)
